On 10/12/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
>
> C=E9dric Beust ? wrot=
e:
>
>
> Don't you think it would be a mistake to tell the users how they
>=
 should work? :-)


Fair enough.

Besides, if the test failed on build or c=
ontinuous integratino server
> you would have to rerun test locally with yo=
ur breakpoint, which would
> be quite waste of time in my opinion, because =
you should know that is
> failed from the report.


Actually, TestNG automa=
tes that since it generates a testng-failed.xml which
you can then feed to =
TestNG to rerun only those tests that failed.

Another quite practical use =
case for test names is that they can be
> potentially used to get better un=
derstanding what part of the
> functionality is broken. Especially if this =
feature is used for some
> integration-level regression tests that may pote=
ntially cover wide range
> of functionality.


Okay. I'm not ruling data pr=
ovider names out, I just decided to start simple
and see what users will do=
 with this feature and find out if it's really
going to be an issue or not.=


--
C=E9dric
